fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: MXF Generic Container Mapped to Uncompressed Images
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Essence container for the MXF file format that carries uncompressed video. Although most mapping information is provided in SMPTE ST 384, a detailed listing of nine picture essence types is provided in Annex G (section G.2.25 in the 2009 edition) of SMPTE ST 377-1. Three of these feature bytestream structures described at this Web site at this time and they are represented in the Relationships section below.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Essence container for the MXF file format that carries uncompressed video. Although most mapping information is provided in SMPTE ST 384, a detailed listing of nine picture essence types is provided in Annex G (section G.2.25 in the 2009 edition) of SMPTE ST 377-1.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Middle-state format for production, material exchange, or archiving.

fdd:localUse.fdd:preference: The Library of Congress National Audio-Visual Conservation Center, Packard Campus, at Culpeper, Virginia, produces MXF_OP1a_JP2_LL files as archival masters as they reformat their older videotapes.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Open standard. Developed by the Society of Motion Picture and Television Engineers (SMPTE), a member of the American National Standards Institute (ANSI).
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:documentation: Two specifications include valuable information: SMPTE ST 384:2005. Television — Material Exchange Format (MXF) — Mapping of Uncompressed Pictures into the MXF Generic Container and SMPTE ST 377-1:2011, Material Exchange Format (MXF) -- File Format Specification, especially annex G.
